blurb: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications. Elixir leverages the Erlang VM, known for running low-latency, distributed and fault-tolerant systems, while also being successfully used in web development and the embedded software domain.

key_features.title: General-purpose
key_features.content: Elixir is used for web development, embedded software, data ingestion, and multimedia processing.

key_features.title: Functional
key_features.content: Multi-clause functions with pattern matching and guards are the building blocks of Elixir code.

key_features.title: Dynamically typed
key_features.content: Elixir has no compile-time type checks, favoring run-time pattern matching.

key_features.title: Immutable
key_features.content: All data in Elixir is immutable, allowing for safer and easier-to-reason-about concurrency.

key_features.title: Concurrent
key_features.content: Elixir uses the actor model - shared-nothing concurrency via message passing.

key_features.title: Fault tolerant
key_features.content: Elixir runs on the Erlang VM, known for running low-latency, distributed and fault-tolerant systems.
